result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto E. Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with felons or known drug dealers, Paul T, Pearl T or any Rowndy's Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP concurrent to 15CM621 and consecutive to 13CF523; 1 year initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; no contact with felons, known drug dealers, Paul T, Pearl T or any Roundy's store.
from deft.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court reads in KPD retail theft charge 1569722.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 4/716 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
Def. was not writted from Dodge for the plea/sentencing hearing on 2/2/16 at 8:30.  Hearing changed from 2/2/16 to 2/4/16 at 11:00.  Date OK with Atty Ekes's calendar.  D.A. notified.

Defendant Roberto E. Gomez appeared with Attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6 .  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
